If you target secured objects or those in another creature's possession (such as sheathed weapons), you must attempt to Disarm the creature of the metal objects, making a spell attack roll instead of an Athletics check to do so.

Instead of drawing the objects to yourself, you can polarize a single metal object within range, designating it as a lodestone and causing the metal objects to fly to it instead. The lodestone must be at least three times the total Bulk of the targeted metal objects. Objects will stick to the lodestone for 1 minute, though they can be wrenched away with an Interact action.
Magnetic Attraction.target: up to 10 metal objects with a total Bulk of 1 or less

Magnetic Repulsion.name: Magnetic Repulsion
Magnetic Repulsion.description:
You adjust your magnetic polarity, causing metal objects to jump and shudder away from you. Attacks made with metal objects against you take a -1 status penalty, and the squares adjacent to you are difficult terrain for creatures wearing metal armor. For creatures made entirely of metal, the penalty to their attack rolls is -2 and the squares adjacent to you are greater difficult terrain.

While this spell is active, you require an additional Interact action before using a metal object (including to Strike with a metal weapon), and if you're wearing metal armor, you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Heightened (+3) The status penalty to attack rolls increases by 1.

Manifold Lives.name: Manifold Lives
Manifold Lives.description:
You cast a creature's mind back through time, forcing them to take other paths and make other choices, experiencing countless alternate lives in an instant. The creature becomes overwhelmed with regret over paths untraveled, lives unlived, and times unrealized. The creature takes [[/r 6d6[mental]]] damage and must attempt a Will save. After the effect is resolved, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 day.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is stupefied 2 for 1 minute. While affected, the creature must attempt another save at the start of its turn; on a failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that turn as it sobs uncontrollably.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and for 1 minute, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} and slowed 1 as it sobs uncontrollably.

Heightened (+1) The mental damage increases by [[/r 1d6]]{1d6}.

Mantis Form.name: Forma de Louva-a-Deus
Mantis Form.description: Você se torna um louva-a-deus. Você recebe os benefícios de forma de inseto, elevada para o nível de forma de louva-a-deus, e pode transformar-se somente em um louva-a-deus.

Mantle of Heaven's Slopes.name: Mantle of Heaven's Slopes
Mantle of Heaven's Slopes.description:
You surround yourself in a mantle of heavenly power, invoking the power of the layers of the celestial mountain above. Your body warps and morphs into an angelic form, made of Heaven's light. Upon Casting this Spell, pick two different options below. As a single action, which has the concentrate trait, you can lose one of the options you chose and select a different one (you don't benefit from having the same option selected twice at the same time).

  • Threshold's Walls Glimmering barriers form around you. You gain cover from the barriers.
  • Proelera's Arsenal Shimmering silver pikes surround you, imposing your might on those who would oppose you. You gain an arsenal unarmed attack, which has the reach and shove traits, in the polearm group. Your arsenal attack deals 1d10 piercing damage as its base damage, plus an additional 1d8 good damage, and counts as silver.
  • Clarion's Sanctity Your eyes glow with golden light, seeing that which others prefer remain unseen. You gain a +2 status bonus on checks to Recall Knowledge and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive}, and when you succeed at a check to Recall Knowledge about a creature you can see, you can attempt to Sense its Motive as a free action.
  • Requius's Rest Your hands glow with soft white energy that spreads to your wounds. You gain fast healing 2.
  • Illumis's Parlance Your voice echoes like a trumpet. You can be heard clearly up to 200 feet away when you speak, if you choose to project your voice.
  • Iuidica's Verdict Your body pulses with scarlet light, pushing away those judged to be against you. As a free action triggered by succeeding at a Strike, you can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the creature you hit.

Martyr's Intervention.name: Martyr's Intervention
Martyr's Intervention.description:
Trigger A creature within range would take damage that reduces it to 0 Hit Points

Requirements You don't have the wounded condition.

You shield a creature in dire need with your own life force, taking the harm upon yourself to save their life. The target is reduced to 1 Hit Point instead of 0 Hit Points. All remaining damage that was prevented from harming the target creature is instead dealt to you. Both you and the target become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 1}; targets who are already wounded increased their wounded value by 1.

Mending.name: Emendar
Mending.target: non-magical object of light Bulk or less

Message Rune.name: Mensagem Rúnica
Message Rune.description:
Você grava uma mensagem com duração de até 5 minutos e inscreve uma runa especial em qualquer superfície plana ao seu alcance. A natureza da aparência da runa depende de você, mas é visível para todos e não deve ser inferior a 2 polegadas de diâmetro. Você também especifica um acionamento que criaturas devem encontrar para ativar a runa. Pela duração da magia, as criaturas que atendem aos critérios do gatilho podem tocar a runa para ouvir a mensagem gravada em sua cabeça, como se você estivesse falando com eles telepaticamente. Você sabe quando alguém está ouvindo a mensagem, mas você não sabe quem está ouvindo. Você pode Dispensar a magia. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Mind Games.name: Mind Games
Mind Games.description:
You lock minds with the target, trying to mentally subdue them. The target must attempt a Will save. Each time you Sustain this Spell, the target attempts another Will save.

Critical Success You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Atordoado 1} and the spell ends.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is stunned 1.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Atordoado 2}.

Mindscape Door.name: Mindscape Door
Mindscape Door.secondarycheck: Arcana or Occultism, Deception or Diplomacy, Perception
Mindscape Door.target: yourself and up to 5 willing creatures

Mirecloak.name: Mirecloak
Mirecloak.description:
You wrap the targeted creatures in thin, sickly green shrouds that sap information from attackers. The shroud settles about each target's shoulders, granting a +1 status bonus to AC and a +2 status bonus to Stealth checks, both only while the target is in dim light or darkness.

If a creature deals damage in melee to or touches a cloaked creature, the cloak wraps around the attacker, temporarily connecting the psyches of the cloaked creature and the attacker and violently prying a random piece of interesting information from the attacker's mind. The attacker takes 2d8 mental damage and must attempt a Will save.

Afterward, the spell ends for the cloaked creature, and the attacker is temporarily immune to mirecloak for 24 hours.

Critical Success The attacker is unaffected.

Success The attacker takes half damage.

Failure The attacker takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. In addition, the cloaked creature gleans a piece of information from the attacker's mind. The details and extent of this information are at the GM's discretion.

Critical Failure As failure, but the attacker takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.mzDgsuuo5wCgqyxR]{Spell Effect: Mirecloak}

Momentary Recovery.name: Momentary Recovery
Momentary Recovery.description: You instantly teleport yourself and any items you're wearing or holding from your current space to a clear space within range that you can see. If this teleportation would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost. After you vanish but before you arrive, you can take up to 2 actions (or the number of actions you spent to cast momentary recovery, if it was fewer than 2 actions). You can't target any other creatures or objects with anything during these actions and any effect with a duration that you create during these actions ends immediately when you arrive. After you arrive, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of your next turn.

Morass of Ages.name: Morass of Ages
Morass of Ages.description:
You surround yourself in temporal eddies that draw out time for those around you, making every step feel like an eternity endured. A creature in the emanation, or that later enters the emanation, must attempt a Fortitude save. The creature makes this save only once and uses the same effect for the duration of the spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet, to a maximum of 60 feet.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success Squares in the emanation are difficult terrain for the creature.

Failure Squares in the emanation are difficult terrain for the creature, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} when it starts its turn in the emanation.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. The creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} against your spell DC to remove the restrained condition.

Mosquito Blight.name: Mosquito Blight
Mosquito Blight.description:
You infest the area with tenacious, biting insects that disease and drain life from creatures in the area. Arthropods (insects, spiders, and similar invertebrates) are unaffected and instead gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, skill checks, saving throws, and Perception checks while within the area. All other creatures are harassed by insects and exposed to the disease witch's hunger when they enter the area and once per day thereafter that they remain in the area. As part of casting this ritual, you create a Tiny ritual insect hive (Hardness 5, 10 HP) that must remain in the ritual's area. If the hive is removed or destroyed, the ritual's effect ends 1 hour later.

Witch's Hunger (disease)

Saving Throw Fortitude

Onset [[/r 1d6 #hours]]{1d6 hours}

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 enfeebled 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}

Stage 5 death

Critical Success As success, and the disease is especially deadly, with Stage 3 instead causing unconsciousness and Stage 4 instead causing death.

Success You create the ritual hive and cast the ritual.

Failure You fail to cast the ritual.

Critical Failure You fail to cast the ritual and instead cause ravenous insects to torment you, immediately exposing you to the witch's hunger disease.
Mosquito Blight.primarycheck: Nature (expert; you must be the Mosquito Witch)

Moth's Supper.name: Moth's Supper
Moth's Supper.description:
You sigh, and your breath transforms into delicate, black‑winged butterflies and huge death's-head hawkmoths. They flutter about you briefly, and then range forth in search of sustenance- fresh-spilled blood, by preference, but rotting corpses, flowering plants, or even left-behind food will do in a pinch. They then return, perching on your hair or shoulders and whispering their secrets into your ears. This has three effects.

  • You heal 2d4 Hit Points every 10 minutes.
  • The first time during the duration when someone successfully Treats your Wounds, you regain an additional 4d4 Hit Points.
  • You gain an imprecise sense out to 30 feet that senses only freshly spilled blood and rotten flesh.

Heightened (+1) The amount of Hit Points healed every 10 minutes increases by 1d4 and the amount of Hit Points regained from the first @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} increases by [[/r 2d4]]{2d4}.

Mother's Blessing.name: Mother's Blessing
Mother's Blessing.description:
You attempt to purify and stabilize the life inside of Ulgrem-Axaan's last remaining clutch of eggs. With its blessing, you wash the eggs clean from the filth of undeath and bury them in warm sand by the banks of a river in Garund.

Critical Success The ritual is successful and the eggs hatch, giving life to an ancient species brought to the brink of extinction by the destruction of their home.

Success As critical success, but only half of the eggs hatch (rounded up). You can try again with the remaining eggs.

Failure No effect, and you must wait a week to try again.

Critical Failure 90% of the eggs shatter (rounded up). You must wait a month to try again.

Movanic Glimmer.name: Movanic Glimmer
Movanic Glimmer.description:
You give the target animal a glimmer of awareness, not truly awakening it but allowing it to better understand its surroundings. The target gains a +2 status bonus to Perception checks and Will saves, and any Nature checks to Command the target Animal gain a +1 status bonus from its increased understanding. Additionally, if the target animal has the minion trait, it can take one action each turn even if its master doesn't use an action to Command it, which it can use to perform any basic action it knows. This doesn't prevent a target that was summoned from disappearing if its summoner doesn't Sustain the Spell, but does allow the target to perform one action before disappearing.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 5 animals.

Mud Pit.name: Mud Pit
Mud Pit.description: Thick, clinging mud covers the ground, 1 foot deep. The mud is difficult terrain.

Murderous Vine.name: Murderous Vine
Murderous Vine.description:
You summon a slithering, thorny vine that attempts to constrict and crush a foe against a wall or other surface. Make a spell attack roll against the target's Fortitude DC. On a success, the creature is grabbed and takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and 2d8 piercing damage. At the end of that creature's turn, if it's still grabbed by the vine, it takes [[/r 2d6[bludgeoning]]] damage.

The vine's Escape DC is equal to your spell DC. A creature can attack the vine in an attempt to break its grip. The vine's AC is equal to your spell DC, and the vine is destroyed if it takes 20 or more damage. Destroying or escaping from the vines ends the spell. You can Dismiss the spell.

Heightened (+2) The initial bludgeoning damage increases by 1d6, the initial piercing damage increases by 1d8, and the damage a creature takes for ending its turn grabbed by the vine increases by [[/r 1d6[bludgeoning]]].
Murderous Vine.target: 1 creature adjacent to a flat surface

Nature's Reprisal.name: Nature's Reprisal
Nature's Reprisal.description:
The plant life within the area begins to writhe and lash out against your enemies as you call upon nature to impede your foes. To your enemies, the area becomes difficult terrain, and areas that were naturally difficult terrain due to plants become greater difficult terrain as well as hazardous terrain, dealing [[/r 6 #poison]]{6 poison damage} to an enemy each time it enters an affected square.

Heightened (+1) The poison damage of the hazardous terrain increases by [[/r 1 #poison]].
Nature's Reprisal.target: all squares on the ground that contain plants in an 80-foot burst

Necrotic Radiation.name: Radiação Necrótica
Necrotic Radiation.description:
Você imbui o objeto ou o espaço tocado com radiação necrótica de ação lenta. Se você lançar a magia em um objeto, qualquer criatura que termine seu turno segurando ou carregando o objeto recebe 2d6 de dano negativo. Se você lançar a magia em uma área, qualquer criatura que termine seu turno na área recebe 2d6 de dano negativo. Você pode tentar usar essa magia em um objeto segurado tocando no objeto. Se o fizer, a criatura faz um teste de Reflexo para reduzir o efeito.

Sucesso Crítico O objeto não é afetado Sucesso A criatura afasta o objeto rapidamente. A magia dura apenas 1 minuto. Falha A criatura consegue proteger levemente o objeto. A magia dura 10 minutos. Falha Crítica A magia dura 24 horas.

Elevada (+2) Aumenta o dano negativo da radiação em 1d6.

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Object Memory.name: Memória de Objetos
Object Memory.description:
Ao tocar em um objeto, você extrai a experiência daqueles que o criaram e o usaram. Se você tocar em uma arma, seu nível de proficiência nessa arma aumenta temporariamente para treinado (se ainda não estiver maior). Se você tocar em uma ferramenta, sua classificação de proficiência com a próxima verificação de pericia que você tentar com essa ferramenta (como um teste de Manufatura com o martelo de ferreiro) durante o período da magia aumenta temporariamente para treinado (se ainda não estiver maior). Essa magia não beneficia atividades que demoram mais de um minuto para serem concluídas.

Elevada (6º) Sua classificação de proficiência aumenta para especialista, em vez de treinado. 

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.uDOxq24S7IT2EcXv]{Spell Effect: Object Memory (Weapon)}

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Object Reading.name: Ler Objeto
Object Reading.description:
Você coloca a mão em um objeto para descobrir uma informação sobre um evento emocional que ocorreu envolvendo o objeto dentro da última semana, conforme determinado pelo MJ. Se conjurar ler objeto no mesmo item novamente, você pode se concentrar em um único evento e obter informações adicionais sobre ele ou receber uma informação sobre outro evento emocional no intervalo de tempo aplicável. 

Elevada (2º) Você pode descobrir algo sobre um evento que ocorreu dentro do último mês. Elevada (4º) Você pode descobrir algo sobre um evento que ocorreu dentro do último ano. Elevada (6º) Você pode descobrir algo sobre um evento que ocorreu dentro da última década. Elevada (8º) Você pode descobrir algo sobre um evento que ocorreu dentro do último século. Elevada (9º) Você pode descobrir algo sobre um evento que ocorreu dentro de toda a história do objeto.

Oblivious Expulsion.name: Oblivious Expulsion
Oblivious Expulsion.description:
Severing ties with a member of a cult courts danger and threatens to undermine the secrecy of the group, whether that secrecy protects its worshippers or enables them to operate in the shadows. Many cults end their association with a wayward member on the edge of a blade, but there are options that preserve both secrecy and the life of the expelled member. An oblivious expulsion removes knowledge of the cult but is time-consuming enough that a cult usually reserves it for only the most well-regarded members who nevertheless need to be removed-or for sleeper agents the cult wishes to place among society and activate later.

It's difficult to cast this ritual unless the target is willing or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. If the creature is unwilling to accept the ritual, it can attempt a Will save to negate the effect. The effects of the ritual depend on the results of your Occultism check.

Critical Success The ritual removes all memories of the cult's activity, practices, and secrets from the target's memory. The target remembers only what an average citizen of the larger society would know, which is typically nothing or a few rumors with very little detail. The spell is hard to detect: a detect magic spell or similar effect must be a higher level than oblivious expulsion to detect it. You can Dismiss the spell. While casting the spell, you can choose to give the secondary casters the ability to Dismiss it. You can also choose to set a key phrase or event that causes the spell to be Dismissed. When the target witnesses this phrase or event, the spell immediately ends.

Success As critical success, except the spell isn't harder to detect with detect magic.

Failure The ritual fails.

Critical Failure The ritual fails, and the target is temporarily immune for 1 month.

Omnidirectional Scan.name: Omnidirectional Scan
Omnidirectional Scan.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]

You quickly view your surroundings from a variety of angles, your senses constructing an overall mental picture. You can choose to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the entire emanation of the spell.

Regardless of whether you Seek, target one ally and one enemy in the area; if a target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from you, you automatically succeed at the flat check to target it with this spell. You prepare to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} the target ally on an attack roll against the target enemy. If you take this Aid reaction, you use your spell attack modifier and proficiency rank on your check to Aid. If you critically fail the roll to Aid, you get a failure instead.

Amp Your scans are so minute that you can project your foe's likely strengths and weaknesses. You learn which of the target enemy's saving throws is highest and which is lowest, and you and all allies within 30 feet gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attacks and damage against the creature.

If you take the Aid reaction you prepared for and succeed at your roll, these bonuses increase to +2 on the attack you're Aiding. On a critical success, they increase to +3, or to +4 if you have legendary proficiency in spell attack rolls.

Ordained Purpose.name: Ordained Purpose
Ordained Purpose.description:
You call upon the authority of cosmic forces of order, overwhelming creatures with remorse and agony for acting outside of their station and purpose.

Enemies in the area take 4d6 mental damage and must attempt a Will save. A creature that has lost abilities as a result of performing acts anathema to its deity or beliefs (such as a champion who violated their tenets and hasn't atoned) uses the outcome one degree of success worse than the result of its saving throw.

At the GM's discretion, a creature currently filling its appointed station and purpose (such as a farmer working in a field or a criminal in the act of committing a crime) uses the outcome one degree of success better than the result of its saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.HYNhdaPtF1QmQbR3]{Drop Prone} as its first action on its next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.HYNhdaPtF1QmQbR3]{Drop Prone} as its first action on its next turn, and can't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.OdIUybJ3ddfL7wzj]{Stand} during its next turn.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

Over the Coals.name: Over the Coals
Over the Coals.description:
You accuse the target of breaking its word to you and invoke the wrath of your patron to claim what's due, demanding the target pay you in currency, fulfill an order, or stand down. The demand can't be obviously self-destructive, or the spell fails. If the target resists, you take your payment from its life force. The target must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of its save, the target is temporarily immune for 1 day.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is immune to your pact broker cantrips for 1 day.

Success If the target doesn't comply with your request by the end of its next turn, it takes [[/r 3d8[persistent,negative]]] damage. If it later complies, the spell automatically ends.

Failure As success, but if the target doesn't comply, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and takes [[/r 6d8[persistent,negative]]] damage.

Critical Failure As success, but if the target doesn't comply, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}, and takes [[/r 6d8[persistent,negative]]] damage. Even if the target completes your commands later, the spell doesn't end until all the conditions end.

Heightened (9th) You can target up to two creatures.

Overflowing Sorrow.name: Tristeza Transbordante
Overflowing Sorrow.description:
A tristeza flui de você para as criaturas próximas, apagando qualquer outro pensamento que eles tenham. A primeira vez que uma criatura começa sua vez na área ou entra na área, deve fazer um teste de Vontade. Se mais tarde sair e entrar novamente na área, utilizará o mesmo efeito de antes. Sucesso Crítico A criatura não é afetada Sucesso A criatura recebe uma penalidade de status -1 nas checagens de pericia e de Percepção enquanto permanecer na área. Falha Enquanto a criatura estiver na área, qualquer efeito emocional reage, qualquer efeito emocional de nível mais baixo que o normal tristeza trasnbordante são suprimidos e, sempre que a criatura tenta usar uma ação emocional ou lançar uma magia emocional, ela deve ter sucesso em um teste simples de CD 11 ou a ação ou a magia é interrompida. Falha Crítica Como falha, mas a criatura não pode usar ações emocionais ou magias. 

Elevada (+2) Ao lançar magia, você pode aumentar a área em 1,5 metros. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Owb Pact.name: Owb Pact
Owb Pact.description:
You call upon an owb to assist you in a goal. Only caligni callers can use this ritual with relative safety. If a different type of caligni attempts this ritual, they use an outcome one degree of success worse than the result of their check. If a non-caligni attempts this ritual, the result is an automatic critical failure.

Critical Success You conjure the owb. It decides your goals closely match its own and doesn't request a favor in return.

Success You conjure the owb. It isn't eager to pursue the task, so it requires a favor in return.

Failure You don't conjure an owb.

Critical Failure You conjure an owb, but it deems you unworthy and siphons away some of your soul energy. All casters become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description:
You and one other target gain an uncanny coordination that helps you take down foes. You and the other target flank any enemy to which you are both adjacent, whether or not you are on opposite sides of the enemy's space.

Heightened (5th) The spell can target you and up to 4 willing creatures touched.

Painted Scout.name: Painted Scout
Painted Scout.description:
You press your hand to the stone, causing hand-drawn scouts to spread out from your fingers. As long as you keep your hand on the wall and Sustain the Spell, you can see, hear, and smell through the painted scout using whatever senses you have (including natural senses like scent or darkvision, or magical effects like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See Invisibility}). You can move the scout up to your Speed along the wall each time you Sustain the Spell. The scout can move anywhere along the wall to a range of 120 feet as long as its path is unbroken; it treats sharp corners and particularly craggy spots on the wall as difficult terrain. The painted scout is bonded to the wall on which you created it and can't move onto another surface or material.

You can spend an action to make the scout @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}, and you can roll a Nature or Occultism check in place of the usual Stealth check. The painted scout must be near a suitably obscured nook or cranny to Hide; it can't Hide or Sneak along a flat, featureless wall. If the painted scout is smeared or doused in water, the scout is destroyed and the spell ends.

Heightened (6th) You create up to five separate painted scouts, and the range to which the scouts can move along the wall increases to 500 feet. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can move one scout up to your Speed, and you can see, hear, and smell through all five scouts simultaneously. A destroyed scout can't be replaced, and the spell ends if all the scouts are destroyed.
Painted Scout.target: a cave wall or other stone surface

Paralyze.name: Paralisar
Paralyze.description:
Você bloqueia os impulsos motores do alvo antes que eles possam sair da mente dele, ameaçando paralisá-lo. O alvo deve tentar um salvamento de Vontade.

Successo Crítico O alvo não é afetado.

Successo O alvo fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Atordoado} 1.

Falha O alvo fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralisado} por 1 rodada.

Falha O alvo fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralisado} por 4 rodadas. No início de cada um dos turnos dele, o alvo deve tentar um novo salvamento de Vontade para reduzir a duração em 1 rodada, ou encerrá-la inteiramente em um sucesso crítico.

Elevada (7º) Você pode afetar até 10 criaturas.

Parch.name: Tostar
Parch.description:
Os ventos secos desidratam uma criatura. O alvo deve tentar um teste de Fortitude; se usada em uma criatura com a característica da água ou em uma criatura feita principalmente de líquido (como muitas limos), a criatura usa o resultado para um grau de sucesso pior que o resultado. Criaturas cujos corpos não contêm umidade significativa (como os elementais da terra) são imunes a tostar. Se uma criatura afetada por tostar bebe um líquido, como um gole de água ou uma poção, a magia termina. Criaturas afetadas que têm o traço água ou são feitos principalmente de líquidos, bem como criaturas afetadas que não podem beber, podem encerrar o efeito como uma atividade de duas ações, que tem o traço concentração.

Sucesso Crítico O alvo não é afetado. Sucesso O alvo recebe uma penalidade de status -1 nos seus testes e CDs por 1 rodada. Falha O alvo recebe uma penalidade de status -1 em seus testes e CDs por 1 minuto. Falha Crítica O alvo recebe uma penalidade de status –2 em seus testes e CDs por 1 minuto e fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{ofucado} desde que tenha essa penalidade.

Elevada (4º) Você pode atingir até 4 criaturas.

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Path of Least Resistance.name: Path of Least Resistance
Path of Least Resistance.description: You trace several possible routes, quickly resetting the timeline until you find the safest one. Choose three spaces you could reach with two Stride actions. Each must be at least 20 feet from the other two. You Stride twice to one of the spaces, determined randomly by the GM from among the paths you chose. If some of the paths contain a hidden danger, such as a trap that you would trigger by walking into the trap's affected area, the GM doesn't consider this path when randomly determining which one you take, but if all options have a hidden danger, the GM randomly chooses between all three paths. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Penumbral Shroud.name: Mortalha Penumbral
Penumbral Shroud.description:
Você envolve o alvo em uma mortalha de sombra. O alvo percebe a luz como um passo mais baixo do que realmente é (luz brilhante torna-se luz fraca, por exemplo), afetando sua capacidade de detectar criaturas e objetos de acordo. A mortalha também fornece ao alvo um bônus de status +1 em testes de resistência contra efeitos de luz. Embora esse efeito seja útil para criaturas sensíveis à luz, se a criatura não estiver disposta, ela pode fazer um teste de Reflexo para evitar a mortalha e reduzir o efeito. Sucesso Crítico O alvo não é afetado. Sucesso O efeito dura 1 rodada. Falha O efeito dura sua duração normal. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Personal Rain Cloud.name: Nuvem Pessoal de Chuva
Personal Rain Cloud.description:
Você conjura uma nuvem de chuva de 1,5 metro de largura que segue o alvo por onde passa. Ela fica mais ou menos no comprimento de um braço, a menos que precise descer mais para caber sob o teto. A nuvem chove constantemente no alvo, mantendo-o molhado e umedecendo o chão após qualquer movimento. A chuva apaga chamas não mágicas. O alvo ganha resistência ao fogo 2. As criaturas com fraqueza na água recebem dano igual à sua fraqueza no final de cada turno. As criaturas podem fazer um teste de Reflexo para evitar a nuvem.

Elevada (+1) A quantidade de resistência ao fogo aumenta em 2. 

(Tradução não oficial - Extinction Curse)

Petal Storm.name: Petal Storm
Petal Storm.description:
You bring forth a cloud of razor-sharp flower petals that thrash violently in the wind. A creature that enters the storm or starts its turn in the storm is sliced by the razor-sharp edges of the petals. It takes 2d10 slashing damage with a basic Reflex save. A creature can take damage from the petals only once per round. At the end of the duration, the storm calms and the petals fall harmlessly to the ground.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by [[/r 1d10]]{1d10}.

Phantasmal Custodians.secondarycheck: Arcana or Occultism (whichever isn't used for the primary check), Diplomacy

Phase Bolt.name: Phase Bolt
Phase Bolt.description:
You point your finger and project a bolt of magical energy that stutters in and out of phase until it reaches the target. Make a ranged spell attack roll against your target's AC; if the target has any circumstance bonuses to AC (such as from a shield or cover), reduce that bonus by 2 for this attack. On a success, you deal [[/r 1d4[piercing]]] damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier. On a critical success, the target takes double damage.

Heightened (+1) The bolt's damage increases by [[/r 1d4]]{1d4}.

Poltergeist's Fury.name: Poltergeist's Fury
Poltergeist's Fury.description:
Your fury spills over in a telekinetic storm of terrifying proportions. Any loose, unattended objects of 1 Bulk or less within range are picked up and begin to orbit you at breathtaking speeds. All creatures in the area take [[/r 6d4[piercing]]] damage with a basic Reflex save. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can increase the radius of the storm by 10 feet, to a maximum of 100 feet. The storm moves with you and provides you with lesser cover, though you can't use this cover to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. Allies within the storm who roll a success on their Reflex save against your poltergeist's fury get a critical success instead, as you attempt to avoid hitting them.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by [[/r 1d4]]{1d4}.

Primal Herd.name: Manada Primal
Primal Herd.target: you and up to 5 willing targets

Prismatic Shield.name: Prismatic Shield
Prismatic Shield.description:
Shield-sized shards of multicolored light manifest in the air around you, each rotating quickly to intercept attacks.

Melee attacks against you impact a randomly colored shard, subjecting the attacker to a random effect from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray}, with a saving throw of the type indicated in that spell.

The shards automatically block physical ranged attacks the size of a spear or smaller, such as arrows, bolts, and javelins. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC against attacks with larger ranged weapons.

Any spell that targets you requires the caster to succeed at a counteract check against your spell DC, or it fails to affect you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Pfllo68qdQjC4Qv6]{Spell Effect: Prismatic Shield}

Procyal Philosophy.name: Procyal Philosophy
Procyal Philosophy.description:
The racoon-like visage of a sagacious procyal appears, dispensing helpful advice. The image appears floating next to the target. The image is just a floating magical manifestation and doesn't occupy any space. The procyal offers helpful suggestions, preparing to Aid the target as though the procyal had its own reaction. The procyal uses a bonus equal to your spell DC - 10 for its rolls to Aid.

On each of your turns, the procyal prepares to Aid its target again. You can use a free action, which has the concentrate trait, to redirect the procyal image to a different creature, changing the target of the spell. Otherwise, the procyal keeps aiding the same creature for the duration of the spell.

Prying Survey.name: Prying Survey
Prying Survey.description:
You create eight invisible, floating eyes, each about 3 inches in diameter, that scan the area around you, transmitting rough impressions of the environment. The eyes constantly examine and send you summaries of their findings. They are solid and can't move through barriers, and they don't follow routes that they fail to find while Searching. Any damage to an eye destroys it. When all eyes are destroyed, the spell ends.

As a single action, which has the concentrate trait, you can concentrate on a location within the area that an eye can reach. An eye travels to that location, and you Seek visually as if you were there. As an exploration activity, you can travel at half speed while continuing to concentrate on the eyes to gain the benefits of both the Scout and Search activities. With the eyes, you can check everything even if you are traveling faster than 300 feet per minute. The eyes use your Perception modifier. You can have only one prying survey in effect at a time.

Heightened (10th) The area increases to a 500-foot emanation.

Purifying Icicle.name: Purifying Icicle
Purifying Icicle.description:
You evoke life essence into the form of water and freeze it, then launch the icicle at a foe. Make a spell attack roll. On a success, the icicle deals 2d6 piercing damage and 1d6 cold damage, and if the target is undead, the icicle deals an additional 1d4 positive damage. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round as the icicle lodges inside them before melting away.

Heightened (+1) The piercing damage and cold damage each increase by 1d6. The positive damage increases by 1d4.

Purifying Veil.name: Purifying Veil
Purifying Veil.description:
Drawing on the purifying powers of water, you call forth a veil of fine water droplets suffused with holy energy. The veil surrounds the target. Everything on each side of the veil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from creatures on the opposite side, but the water doesn't impede attacks or movement across the veil. If the target moves through the veil, it takes 4d6 good damage with a basic Will save. If the target leaves the veil, the spell ends.

Heightened (+1) The good damage increases by [[/r 1d6]]{1d6}.

Putrefy Food and Drink.name: Putrefy Food and Drink
Putrefy Food and Drink.description:
You cause otherwise edible food to rot and spoil instantly, and water and other liquids to become brackish and undrinkable. @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water}, @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.EGhUorZhB7nV73Ev]{Unholy Water}, and similar food and drink of significance are spoiled by this spell, unless they are associated with a deity of decay or putrefaction, but it has no effect on creatures of any type, potions, or alchemical elixirs. One cubic foot of liquid is roughly 8 gallons.

Heightened (2nd) You can target an alchemical elixir with this spell, attempting a counteract check against it. If you succeed, the elixir spoils and becomes a mundane item.

Heightened (3rd) You can target a potion or alchemical elixir with this spell, attempting a counteract check against it. If you succeed, the elixir or potion spoils and becomes a mundane item.
Putrefy Food and Drink.target: 1 cubic foot of clean food or water

Quicken Time.name: Quicken Time
Quicken Time.description: You speed up the time stream in an area, stretching and pulling it until time flows swift and wild. Any creature that begins its turn in the area is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use the extra action each round to Stride or Strike. Unfortunately, speeding up time is much more difficult than slowing it down, and the effect is uneven and jittery, making accuracy between times painfully difficult; creatures inside the area are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to those outside it, and vice versa.

Radiant Beam.name: Radiant Beam
Radiant Beam.description:
You fire a beam of blinding light from your outstretched hands. The beam deals 5d10 good damage. On a failed saving throw, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round, or dazzled for 4 rounds on a critical failure.

If the light passes through an area of magical darkness or targets a creature affected by magical darkness, radiant beam attempts to counteract the darkness. If you need to determine whether the light passes through an area of darkness, draw a line between yourself and the target.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.

Radiant Heart of Devotion.name: Radiant Heart of Devotion
Radiant Heart of Devotion.description:
You speak a fervent prayer for the heavens to assist you and your righteous allies. Your heart begins to glow with a radiance that fills the area with bright light. The spell has the following effects on creatures in the area, based on the creature's alignment on the good-evil axis.

  • Good Creatures Good creatures in the emanation gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and their Strikes deal an additional 1d6 good damage.
  • Neutral Creatures Neutral creatures that begin their turn in the emanation must succeed at a Will save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.
  • Evil Creatures Evil creatures that begin their turn in the emanation must succeed at a Will save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Heightened (+2) The additional good damage increases by 1d6.

Raga of Remembrance.name: Raga of Remembrance
Raga of Remembrance.description:
You scribe occult symbols on unblighted Vudran ground, laying the ceramics within them to create a ritual space. To perform the ritual, light incense in the ceramics and sit at the center of the ritual space. You then play the disharmonic instrument, drawing on musical skill, occult harmonics, or religious tradition. This establishes an underlying drone atop which the secondary casters layer their own performances. The song calls to the millions who died defending Vudra from Kothogaz, investing their power in Vanitapati, the legendary psychic.

Critical Success A towering, ethereal avatar of Vanitapati manifests around you, surrounded by swirling spirits. The avatar weakens Kothogaz's spirit. While Kothogaz is within 1 mile of you, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and is permanently destroyed if reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Success As critical success, but Kothogaz is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The dead come to your aid, but their presence is unnerving. As success, but Kothogaz isn't frightened, and the primary and secondary casters take a -1 status penalty to saving throws against emotion effects.

Critical Failure Rather than the dead, Kothogaz hears the ritual's call and immediately teleports to the primary caster with its Disharmonic Door ability. Primary and secondary casters are afflicted with many-eyed blight.
Raga of Remembrance.secondarycheck: Diplomacy or Performance; Nature; Religion or Society

Rally Point.name: Rally Point
Rally Point.description:
You mark the area touched as a rally point. During the spell's duration, you can take a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to teleport to the rally point along with items you are wearing or holding. This teleportation fails if the area is occupied, if the rally point is more than 120 feet away, or if you try to bring along any other creature, even if it's in an extradimensional container. Once you teleport to the rally point, the spell's duration ends.

Heightened (7th) You can target up to four other creatures within 30 feet, in addition to yourself. Each of you can teleport to the rally point once during the spell's duration, by taking a single action, which has the concentrate trait. The duration no longer ends once you teleport to the rally point, though you still can't teleport to the rally point again.

Ravening Maw.name: Boca Voraz
Ravening Maw.description:
Você evoca a fome incessante de Zevgavizeb e a inflige ao seu alvo. O alvo fica sobrecarregado com a fome canibalística e pode restaurar sua vitalidade banqueteando-se com a carne dos caídos. Por sua vez, o alvo pode usar 2 ações (essas ações têm o traço manipulação) canibalizar uma criatura adjacente @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{morrendo} ou morta. Se a criatura canibalizada está @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{morrendo}, ela morre imediatamente. Se a criatura canibalizada for um aliado do alvo, ele recupera 5d8 PV; caso contrário, o alvo recuperará 5d4 PV. Certos monstros (como aqueles cujo sangue é ácido ou mágico) podem infligir efeitos adicionais sobre aqueles que os canibalizam, a critério do Mestre. Uma vez canibalizado, o corpo de uma criatura em particular não possui carne suficiente para canibalizar novamente. Durante qualquer rodada, que houver uma criatura @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{morrendo} ou morta a 9 metros do alvo, se o alvo não pode ou não canibaliza uma criatura, o alvo sofre 5d4 de dano mental.

Elevada (+1) A quantidade de PV restaurado por canibalização de uma criatura aumenta em 1d8 por comer um aliado e 1d4 caso contrário, e o dano mental aumenta em 1d4. 

(Tradução não oficial - Extinction Curse)

Recall Past Life.name: Recall Past Life
Recall Past Life.description:
You and the secondary casters spend 2 days drawing sigils on one another. At the end of the second day, the secondary caster responsible for the Crafting check carefully mixes the wine with the herbs and a small amount of saliva or blood from the target. The target then drinks the concoction, entering a state of metaphorical death and rebirth, their body becoming comatose for the final day of the ritual. During this time, you and the other secondary caster bathe the body in dirt, symbolizing a grave, and sprinkle the remainder of the wine around the body. If done properly, swaddled baby orchids grow around the area, enveloping the body in a bed of flowers.

On the final hour, the target returns to life, waking up temporarily possessed by an incarnation from one of their past lives. Though they retain the memories from their current life, their demeanor and personality are different for the remaining duration of the ritual, and they also remember vivid details from their past life. Unfortunately, it's impossible to choose a particular past self or to know whether a given former incarnation has good or bad intentions.

Critical Success The target's personality reverts to a previous incarnation, determined by the GM. Normally they keep their abilities, but in rare cases, the GM might determine that the past incarnation has a different set of abilities based on their previous life. The lingering knowledge of the past incarnation is powerful and sticks with the target, allowing them to retrain one of their skills increases into a skill in which the past incarnation was particularly talented; the list of possible skills depends on the nature of the past incarnation and is determined by the GM.

Success As critical success, except there's no lingering knowledge, and the target isn't able to retrain a skill increase.

Failure Nothing happens, though the target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} state is disturbing, and they wake up @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} as well as likely hungry and thirsty.

Critical Failure The sigils are drawn improperly, or the wine was tainted. The swaddled baby orchids that grow around the body scream at the moment when the target would've awakened. The target dies and immediately animates as a malevolent zombie that carries the rot with them and seeks to destroy their former allies. Use the statistics for a husk zombie (Book of the Dead 170), or another zombie as appropriate for the target's ancestry.
Recall Past Life.target: the secondary caster who doesn't perform the Crafting check

Redact.name: Redigir
Redact.description:
Você menciona um nome específico de um ou mais documentos. Ao lançar o feitiço, dê um nome próprio, seja uma criatura, local ou objeto. Qualquer menção desse nome no documento fica embaçada, manchada ou completamente ilegível. Epítetos e referências inequívocas ao nome também são editados; por exemplo, editando o nome da deusa Sarenrae de um livro também removeria referências ao seu título "A Flor do Alvorecer".

Elevada (3º) Em vez de localizar um determinado nome, você pode substituí-lo por um nome diferente que escolher. Epítetos e referências são substituídos por outros semelhantes, relacionados ao nome da substituição. Qualquer pessoa que esteja lendo o texto pode tentar um teste de Percepção ou Sociedade contra a CD da sua magia para perceber o texto alterado, embora isso não lhes diga o que o original diz. Elevada (4º) À sua escolha, a duração é ilimitada. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)
Redact.target: unattended written materials of up to 1 Bulk or less

Reflective Scales.name: Escamas Reflexivas
Reflective Scales.description:
Você cresce um conjunto de escamas brilhantes coloridas ou cota de escamas que armazenam energia antes de liberá-la em uma explosão final. Ao lançar essa magia, escolha ácido, frio, fogo, eletricidade ou dano de veneno. Você ganha resistência 5 contra esse tipo de dano. A cor das escamas depende do tipo de dano que você escolheu e geralmente é a cor de um tipo de dragão ou outra criatura associada a esse tipo de dano, como vermelho ou dourado para dano de fogo. As escamas armazenam energia à medida que o protegem. Acompanhe quanto dano as escamas impediram. Como uma atividade de duas ações que tem os traços concentração e manipulação, você pode explodir suas escamas para fora em um raio de 6 metros ao seu redor, causando 1d6 de dano do tipo escolhido a todas as criaturas da área a cada 10 danos que as escamas impediram, com um máximo de 10d6 de dano (após evitar 100 danos). Depois de fazer isso, a magia termina.

Elevada (+2) A resistência aumenta em 5 e o dano máximo da explosão da balança aumenta em 5d6. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Reincarnate.name: Reincarnate
Reincarnate.target: 1 dead creature of up to 8th level

Remember the Lost.name: Lembrar dos Perdidos
Remember the Lost.description:
Você invoca os perdidos e esquecidos, atacando a mente de seus inimigos com as memórias daqueles que morreram com uma queixa por eles. Inimigos na área recebem 6d6 de dano mental (salvamento básico de Vontade) e ficam @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{assustado} 1 em uma falha crítica. Se você souber o nome de alguém assassinado ou gravemente prejudicado por um inimigo na área, poderá cantar o nome dessas vítimas ao lançar a magia para melhorar a clareza das visões, aumentando o dano ao inimigo correspondente de 6d6 para 6d10; você pode fazer isso para vários inimigos se conhecer as vítimas de cada inimigo. As visões são pessoais para cada inimigo na área, e você não pode usar esse feitiço para discernir um assassino, adivinhando um nome. Uma criatura que realmente conhece ninguém que tenha morrido com qualquer tipo de queixa é imune a esse efeito.

Elevada (+1) O dano aumenta em 2d6 (ou 2d10 em um inimigo quando você nomeia uma vítima específica). 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Return Beacon.name: Return Beacon
Return Beacon.description:
You create a unique planar beacon somewhere within the spell's range that remains in place. The beacon is invisible except when detected by detect magic, in which case it looks like a 10-foot-wide tower of bright light stretching into the sky. At any time during the duration of the beacon, you can complete a 1-minute activity, which has the concentrate and manipulate traits, to focus on the beacon and transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to the location of the beacon. Transporting yourself in this way ends the spell. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the beacon collapses, ending the spell, and the transportation attempt fails.

Casting return beacon while a beacon is active causes the previous return beacon spell to end. If you are not within 1 mile of the beacon, your attempt to transport yourself to the beacon fails. If a solid object is in the same space as the beacon when you transport yourself, you arrive in the nearest open space to the beacon. If there is not an open space within 30 feet of the beacon, your attempt to transport yourself fails, but the beacon remains intact.

Heightened (7th) The duration is 8 hours and you can transport yourself to the beacon from up to 100 miles away.

Heightened (8th) The duration is 24 hours and you can transport yourself to the beacon from up to 1,000 miles away. In addition, you can bring 1 willing ally you touch with you when you transport to the beacon.

Heightened (9th) The duration is 1 week and you can transport yourself to the beacon from anywhere on the same plane. In addition, you can bring up to 4 willing allies you touch with you when you transport to the beacon.

Heightened (10th) The duration is unlimited and you can transport yourself to the beacon from any distance, even across other planes. In addition, you can bring up to 8 willing allies you touch when you transport to the beacon.

Return To Essence.name: Return To Essence
Return To Essence.description:
You unravel the magic of a spell that affects a container, door, or lock, converting it into energy you can repurpose to power your own spells.

Attempt a counteract check against the target spell or magical effect that wards or seals a doorway or chest, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Azoh0BSoCASrA1lr]{Lock}, or against a spell or effect that deals damage or delivers secondary effects when it's opened, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.o0l57UfBm9ScEUMW]{Glyph of Warding}. If you succeed, you recover its energy, restoring one of your expended spell slots of 3rd level or lower.

Heightened (8th) You can restore an expended spell slot of 4th level or lower.

Heightened (9th) You can restore an expended spell slot of 5th level or lower.

Heightened (10th) You can restore an expended spell slot of 6th level or lower.
Return To Essence.target: one magically sealed or warded doorway or chest

Return the Favor.name: Return the Favor
Return the Favor.description:
Trigger An ally uses a reaction to grant you a beneficial effect during a combat encounter.

You're unable to leave any debts unpaid. When an ally supports you in a fight, you offer assistance in turn for the favor. The triggering ally gains 12 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

Heightened (+1) The temporary Hit Points increase by 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.cSoL5aMy3PCzM4Yv]{Spell Effect: Return the Favor}

Rime Slick.name: Geada Escorregadia
Rime Slick.description:
Você chama um vento frio. Quando você conjura esta magia, você causa 2d4 de dano de frio a cada criatura na área (salvamento básico de Reflexo). Se uma criatura na área falha criticamente em seu teste de Reflexo e estava em pé, ela também cai @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{prostrada}.

Você também cria uma camada de gelo em todas as superfícies da área, que se tornam terrenos difíceis. Objetos desapossados na área ficam escorregadios com gelo, e buscá-los exige um teste bem-sucedido de salvamento de Reflexo ou Acrobatismo contra sua CD de magia. O gelo derrete em qualquer objeto que receba dano de fogo, bem como em qualquer quadrado incluído na área da magia ou efeito de nível superior com o traço fogo.

Elevada (5º) O dano aumenta para 8d4 de dano de frio e a área é uma explosão de 9 metros. Elevada (8º) O dano aumenta para 14d4 de dano de frio e a área é uma explosão de 18 metros.

(Tradução não oficial - Extinction Curse)

Rite of the Red Star.name: Rite of the Red Star
Rite of the Red Star.secondarycheck: DC 35 Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion

Ritual Obstruction.name: Ritual Obstruction
Ritual Obstruction.description: You establish a zone of magical feedback that makes it impossible to succeed at rituals of this spell's level or lower in the area. Ritual obstruction ignores all cover, including walls and ceilings, to the extent of its area. Anyone attempting to cast a ritual within the area knows, when they begin to cast the ritual, the area is cursed to impede rituals. Any ritual cast in the area can't have a final result better than failure.

Scintillating Safeguard.name: Scintillating Safeguard
Scintillating Safeguard.target: up to 5 willing creatures who would be harmed by the triggering effect

Scouring Pulse.name: Scouring Pulse
Scouring Pulse.description:
Area 10-foot radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder

You inundate the area with concentrated positive energy, which scours away the stain of undeath. Each creature in the area takes 6d8 positive damage and must attempt a basic Reflex save. Creatures that fail the save also take [[/r 1d8[persistent,positive]]] damage. Creatures that take persistent positive damage from scouring pulse are wreathed in a heatless halo of light. They emit bright light in a 5-foot radius preventing them from being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}; if the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, they're concealed while affected by scouring pulse, rather than being undetected.

Heightened (8th) The positive damage increases to 9d8 damage, and the persistent positive damage increases to [[/r 2d8[persistent,positive]]] damage. Creatures remain suffused in light for [[/r 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 additional rounds} after removing the persistent positive damage.

Scouring Sand.name: Esfregar na Areia
Scouring Sand.description:
Você explode a área com areia que arrasta o solo e entra nos olhos das criaturas. Durante a duração da magia, qualquer terreno difícil baseado em planta menor que uma árvore fica solto, permitindo que cada metro quadrado de um metro e meio seja limpo com uma única ação de Interagir. além do que, além do mais, esfregar na areia tenta neutralizar emanharar e outros efeitos que criam ou manipulam terrenos baseados em plantas em sua área. A neutralização bem-sucedida de um efeito remove apenas a parte de sua área que se sobrepõe à área de esfregar com areia. Após uma dessas tentativas, o efeito é temporariamente imune a neutralização de esfregar com areia por 24 horas. Cada criatura na área quando você conjura esta magia ou que termina seu turno na área deve fazer um teste de salvamento de Reflexo.

Sucesso A criatura não é afetada. Falha A criatura fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{ofuscada} por 1 minuto ou até que ele use uma ação de Interagir para tirar a areia dos olhos. Falha Crítica Como fracasso, mas a criatura também é @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{cega} para sua próxima ação.

Elevada (3º) Uma vez por rodada quando você Sustentar a magia, você pode mover o centro da explosão para um local dentro do alcance. Elevada (6º) Como a versão de 3º nível, exceto o alcance de 36 metros e a área é uma explosão de 6 metros.

(Tradução não oficial - Extinction Curse)

Sea Surge.name: Surto de Onda
Sea Surge.description:
Você bate ou pisa em uma superfície sólida ou líquida próxima, enviando uma onda de água correndo para longe de você. A água forma uma parede plana de 1,5 metros de espessura e 3 metros de altura, entre 1,5 e 4,5 metros de largura (você decide). Ela se move 18 metros na direção de sua escolha ao longo da superfície atingida, extinguindo todos os incêndios não mágicos, carregando objetos não segurados de Volume 1 ou menor e empurrando objetos maiores. A onda se move mais 18 metros na mesma direção no início do seu próximo turno e depois desaparece. Criaturas grandes ou menores na área ou que entram na área pela qual a onda se move devem fazer um teste de salvamento de Fortitude.

Sucesso A criatura não é afetada. Falha A criatura fica knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{prostrada}. Se a criatura estava Nadando, em vez disso, ocorre uma falha crítica. Falha Crítica A criatura é empurrada 6 metros na direção da onda, é cai @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{prostrada}, e leva 3d6 de dano por esmagamento.

(Tradução não oficial - Extinction Curse)

Sea of Thought.name: Sea of Thought
Sea of Thought.description:
You cover the area in a sloshing torrent of semi-solidified thought, roughly ankle high. The area becomes difficult terrain, similarly to a shallow bog. Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the shifting waves of thought. On a failure, it takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Heightened (+1) The radius of the spell's area increases by 5 feet.

Secret Chest.target: 1 container and its contents, totaling 10 Bulk or less

Shadow Double.primarycheck: Arcana or Occultism (master, the check has the secret trait)
Shadow Double.secondarycheck: Arcana, Nature, Occultism, Religion, or Society (whichever is required to Recall Knowledge about the creature being duplicated); Crafting; Deception

Shadow Spy.name: Shadow Spy
Shadow Spy.description: You mix blood, soil, and shadow together to form a half-real homunculus in the shape of a crow, sparrow, or other bird. You then command the bird to fly to a location within range and observe all around it. The bird has the statistics of a homunculus, save that it has all of your senses and shares your Perception modifier. Once the spell's duration elapses or upon a trigger you set (which must be fairly simple-"at dusk" or "when the judge leaves"), the bird flies to your location. If you wring its neck and drink its blood, you learn all that it saw since its creation.

Shaken Confidence.name: Shaken Confidence
Shaken Confidence.description:
Trigger An enemy within 30 feet of you critically fails an attack roll, Perception check, or skill check.

You mock the target for all its failings, twisting its self-confidence into doubt. The enemy attempts a Will saving throw.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is briefly shaken and unsure of its abilities. It must roll twice and take the worse result on the next roll of the same type as the critical failure that triggered the spell (such as the target's next Acrobatics check if the spell's trigger was a critical failure on an Acrobatics check). If the target doesn't attempt any qualifying checks, the spell ends at the end of the target's next turn.
Shaken Confidence.target: An enemy that critically failed an attack roll, Perception check, or skill check

Shall not Falter, Shall not Rout.name: Shall not Falter, Shall not Rout

Shambling Horror.name: Shambling Horror
Shambling Horror.target: 1 corpse of a Gargantuan or smaller creature that has a level no greater than your level -4 and has died since the last sunrise

Share Burden.name: Compartilhar Fardo
Share Burden.description:
Acionamento Um aliado a 9 metros está prestes a tentar um teste de resistência contra um efeito emocional prejudicial, e você não precisaria resistir contra o efeito.

Você suporta um pouco da dor do seu aliado. Você e seu aliado usam o resultado um grau de sucesso melhor do que o resultado do teste de resistência do seu aliado, mesmo que o efeito desencadeador geralmente afete apenas um alvo.

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Share Lore.name: Saber Compartilhado
Share Lore.description:
Você compartilha seu conhecimento com as criaturas tocadas. Escolha uma pericia de Saber em que você é treinado. Os alvos se tornam treinados nessa pericia de Saber pela duração da magia.

Elevada (3º) A duração da magia é de 1 hora e você pode atingir até cinco criaturas. Elevada (5º) A duração da magia é de 8 horas, você pode atingir até cinco criaturas e compartilhar até duas pericias de Saber nas quais você é treinado. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Shatter Mind.name: Shatter Mind
Shatter Mind.description:
@Template[type:cone|distance:15]

You telepathically assail the minds of your foes. You deal mental damage equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier to all enemies in the area, with a basic Will save.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by [[/r 1d4]]{1d4}.

Amp You increase the area of the spell to your choice of a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] or @Template[type:cone|distance:60], and the damage dice for the spell change to d10s. Creatures that fail are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the start of your next turn (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure).

Shattering Gem.name: Joia Estilhaçada
Shattering Gem.description:
Uma grande gema flutua ao redor do alvo em um padrão irregular. A gema tem 5 pontos de vida. Cada vez que uma criatura atinge o alvo, o alvo faz um teste simples CD 11. Em caso de sucesso, a gema bloqueia o ataque; portanto, o ataque primeiro danifica a gema e depois aplica qualquer dano restante ao alvo. Se a gema for reduzida a 0 Pontos de Vida, ela será destruída, causando imediatamente a criatura que a destruiu 1d8 de dano cortante (salvamento básico de Reflexo), desde que a criatura esteja a menos de 3 metros do alvo.

Elevada (+1) A gema tem 5 pontos de vida adicionais, e o dano causado por sua detonação aumenta em 1d8. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Shifting Sand.name: Areia Movediça
Shifting Sand.description:
Você faz com que a superfície se solte. A área se torna um terreno difícil e quaisquer trilhas na área são destruídas pelo chão agitado. As criaturas que estão na área recebem uma penalidade de status -1 nos testes de Acrobacias para Equilibrar e Atravessar Acrobraticamente nos testes de Atletismo para Salto em Altura e Salto em Distância. Quando você Sustentar a magia, pode mover a área de agitação até 3 metros em qualquer direção. Criaturas imobilizadas pela magia são transportadas junto com a areia movediça na mesma direção, se possível; esse movimento é um movimento forçado. As criaturas que entram ou começam sua vez de pé na areia movediça devem fazer um teste de Reflexos. Critical Success A criatura não é afetada e ignora o terreno difícil da área e a penalidade nos testes de habilidade até o final do seu turno. Sucesso A criatura ignora a penalidade da área em testes de habilidade até o final do seu turno. Falha A criatura é afetada normalmente pela magia neste turno. Falha Crítica A criatura fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{imobilizada} dentro da área da magia até Escapar. Se a criatura já estava imobilizada pelas areias movediças, ela também cai @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{prostrada}.

Elevada (5º) A penalidade de status aumenta para –2 e o alcance da mágica aumenta para 18 metros. Elevada (7º) A penalidade de status aumenta para –3, o alcance da mágica aumenta para 19 metros e a área da magia aumenta para uma explosão de 9 metros. Elevada (9º) A penalidade de status aumenta para –4, o alcance da magia aumenta para 18 metros e a área da magia aumenta para uma explosão de 12 metros. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods anda Magic)

Shockwave.name: Onda de Choque
Shockwave.description:
Você cria uma onda de energia que ondula pela terra. As criaturas terrestres na área afetada devem fazer um teste de salvamento de Reflexos para evitar tropeçar enquanto a onda de choque sacode o chão. Sucesso Crítico A criatura não é afetada. Sucesso A criatura fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenida} até o início de seu próximo turno. Falha A criatura cai @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{prostrada}. Falha Crítica Como falha, mais a criatura recebe 1d6 de dano.

Elevada (+1) A área aumenta em 1,5 metro (para um cone de 6 metros no 2º nível e assim por diante). 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Show the Way.name: Mostre o Caminho
Show the Way.description:
Você e os aliados afetados adquirem conhecimento sobrenatural do caminho à frente, permitindo que você intua o melhor caminho a seguir e evite possíveis obstáculos, como terrenos difíceis ou confusos. Para fins de viagens terrestres de longa distância durante o modo de exploração, viajar por terrenos difíceis reduz você a apenas três quartos da sua velocidade de viagem em vez de metade, e viajar por terrenos mais difíceis reduz a velocidade de sua viagem para apenas metade da sua velocidade de viagem em vez de um-terço. Mostrar o caminho não impede que você caia em armadilhas ou encontre outros obstáculos e perigos artificiais.

Elevada (+6) Para fins de viagens terrestres de longa distância durante o modo de exploração, viajar por terrenos difíceis não reduz a velocidade de sua viagem, e viajar por terrenos mais difíceis reduz a velocidade de viagem para apenas três-quartos do seu valor normal em vez de um-terço. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Shrink Item.name: Encolher Item
Shrink Item.target: 1 non-magical object up to 20 cubic feet in volume and up to 80 Bulk

Shrink the Span.description: Você se move tão rápido que vira um borrão pelos limites planares. Você se teleporta até uma distância igual à sua Velocidade em sua linha de visão.

Shroud of Flame.name: Manto de Chamas
Shroud of Flame.description:
You encircle yourself in an aura of protective flames. Each creature that hits you with an unarmed attack, Grapples you, or otherwise touches you takes [[/r 3[fire]]] damage. When you Cast the Spell and the first time you sustain it each round, each creature in the area takes [[/r 3d6[fire]]] damage (basic Reflex save).

Heightened (+1) The damage caused by touching you increases by 1, and the fire damage when you Cast the Spell or sustain it increases by 1d6.

Slough Skin.name: Renovar Pele
Slough Skin.description:
Você remove a camada superior da pele de forma contínua e inofensiva, enquanto a nova pele se regenera imediatamente, afastando rapidamente as substâncias nocivas do corpo. O teste de salvamento para ser removido @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{dano persistente} dos efeitos que revestem sua pele (como a maioria dos danos persistentes com ácido) são reduzidos para 5 e você ganha um bônus de status +2 em seu salvamento inicial contra veneno de contato (mas não em salvamentos adicionais, pois nesse ponto a toxina já entrou no seu sistema). Se você está sofrendo de um efeito diferente de @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{dano persistente} isso depende do contato contínuo com a sua pele; se esse efeito permitir um teste de resistência, você receberá um novo teste de resistência contra esse efeito no final de cada turno, quando tentar seus testes simples contra @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{dano persistente}, e você também recebe um bônus de status +2 para esses testes de resistência. Embora afetado por essa magia, sua pele continuamente se torna mais fácil de Rastrear. Qualquer um que rastreie você ganha +2 de bônus de circunstância e você não pode Ocultar suas trilhas. 

(Tradução não oficial - Gods and Magic)

Soft Landing.name: Soft Landing
Soft Landing.description: You create a magical field that buoys any creature or object falling into the area, providing a harmless landing from any height. As you generally fall 1,500 feet per round, you can cast this spell while you are falling to ensure a safe landing, provided you can see your landing point and it's within range.

Song of the Fallen.name: Canção dos Caídos
Song of the Fallen.description:
Você entoa um cântico ou uma elegia que ou desperta os mortos em ação ou lembra aos mortos-vivos que eles devem descansar.

Se você atingir criaturas mortas, os corpos se animam e podem continuar agindo como se estivessem vivos. Uma criatura animada dessa maneira possui 60 Pontos de Vida temporários. As criaturas animadas são @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{lento} 1 mas pode agir normalmente. As criaturas animadas com essa magia morrem novamente quando a magia termina.

Se você atingir criaturas mortas-vivas, cada morto-vivo deve tentar um salvamento básico de Vontade.

Sucesso Crítico O morto-vivo recebe 5d6 de dano positivo. Sucesso O morto-vivo sofre 10d6 de dano positivo e fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{lento} 1 por 1 rodada. Falha O morto-vivo recebe 100 de dano positivo e fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{lento} 1 por 1 minuto. Falha Crítica O mortos-vivo é destruído.

(Tradução não oficial - Age of Ashes)
Song of the Fallen.target: up to 4 dead creatures or up to 4 undead creatures

Soothing Blossoms.name: Soothing Blossoms
Soothing Blossoms.description:
Blossoms grow from the ground in a small area, soothing away afflictions and persistent pains and harm. When any creature in that area rolls a successful save against a poison or disease effect, it gets a critical success instead. The blossoms grant assisted recovery to everyone in the area to end their persistent damage, both when the spell is cast and at the start of each of your turns. Once the duration ends, the flowers lose their magical effect, but a few of them might survive in the area as long as they can naturally. This spell doesn't give a benefit on a save against an affliction unless the stage lasts 10 minutes or less.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.nIryhRgeiacQw1Em]{Spell Effect: Soothing Blossoms}

Soothing Mist.target: 1 willing living creature or 1 undead creature

Soul Siphon.name: Soul Siphon
Soul Siphon.description:
You siphon off a portion of the target's soul to bolster your own vitality. The target must attempt a Fortitude save or take 1d4 negative damage. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to the total amount of HP the target loses, including the HP lost from becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage by 1d4.

Soulshelter Vessel.name: Soulshelter Vessel
Soulshelter Vessel.description:
You connect the spirit of the target creature with the target object, giving their spirit a durable vessel that protects and empowers their body. You create a pool of healing within the object, which starts out with 40 HP worth of healing per Bulk of the object. (These HP can only be used by the creature, and don't increase the object's HP.) When you Cast the Spell, the targeted creature regains 10 HP, which come out of the object's pool. You can also spend a single action-which has the concentrate, good, healing, necromancy, and positive traits-to repeat this transfer. When the pool is empty, the object becomes broken. The spell ends if the object becomes broken or the targets are no longer within 500 feet of each other.

If the target creature would be reduced to 0 Hit Points, the creature regains either 20 HP or the amount left in the object's pool, whichever is lower. The object immediately becomes broken, ending the spell.

Heightened (+2) Increase the maximum Bulk of the item by 1 (potentially increasing the size of the healing pool), the amount of HP exchanged each time the stone is used by 5, and the amount of HP exchanged when the creature would be reduced to 0 HP by 10 (or by the amount left in the pool, if it's lower).
Soulshelter Vessel.target: 1 willing creature and 1 non-magical stone object of 1 or 2 Bulk

Speaking Sky.name: Speaking Sky
Speaking Sky.description:
The air speaks to you. You can precisely sense any motion within 60 feet through vibration and air movement.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.mhklZ6wjfty0bF44]{Spell Effect: Speaking Sky}

Spirit Object.name: Spirit Object
Spirit Object.description:
Using a sliver of Baba Yaga's power, you briefly bring an object to life. The object gains a means of locomotion, such as sprouting chicken legs, and Strides up to 25 feet to a space you decide within range. If you spent 2 actions Casting the Spell, the object then attacks one creature of your choice adjacent to its new space. Make a melee spell attack roll against the creature. On a success, the creature takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (as appropriate for the object) equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier, and on a critical success, it takes double damage.

Heightened (+1) Increase the maximum Bulk of the target by 1 and the damage by 1d4.

Spiritual Anamnesis.name: Anamnese Espiritual
Spiritual Anamnesis.description:
Memórias de uma vida passada que parecem incrivelmente reais (e podem até ser) dominam a mente do alvo. Isso é especialmente desorientador para mortos-vivos e criaturas que viveram uma vida anterior (como celestiais, demônios, monitores e muitas outras criaturas extraplanares); se essas criaturas obtêm sucesso crítico em seus testes de salvamento, elas obtêm um sucesso no lugar e, se tiram uma falha, obtêm uma falha crítica no lugar.  Sucesso Crítico A criatura não é afetada. Sucesso A criatura fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{lenta} 1 por 1 rodada. Falha O alvo fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{lento} 1 por 1 minuto e murmura sobre as visões, possivelmente fornecendo informações sobre o que eles viram. Falha Crítica Como falha, mas o alvo também fica @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{atordoado} 3.

(Tradução não oficial - Age of Ashes)

Split Shadow.primarycheck: Arcana or Occultism (master, the check has the secret trait)

Split the Tongue.name: Split the Tongue
Split the Tongue.description:
The deceiving creature's tongue splits like a serpent's tongue. The creature takes 1d8 slashing damage and must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/r 1d4]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for [[/r 1d4]]{1d4 rounds}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.
Split the Tongue.target: A creature within 30 feet fails a Deception or Diplomacy check.

Stagnate Time.name: Stagnate Time
